Post._content:
### 


[gitbook](https://www.gitbook.io/)  

gitbook`gitbook`.

[![NPM](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/201502/gitbook.png)](https://nodei.co/npm/gitbook/)




1. [git](http://git-scm.com/ "git")[github](https://github.com/ "github")
2. Markdown
3. nodejsgitbookgitbook
4. PDF, ePub, mobiAmazon



### 

1. nodejs[nodejs](http://nodejs.org/download/ "nodejs")
![windows nodejs](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/2015/nodejs.png)

2. gitbook

``` bash
npm install -g gitbook
```

gitbook:    

``` bash
build [options] [source_dir] Web(_book)    
serve [options] [source_dir] Web    
pdf [options] [source_dir] PDF    
epub [options] [source_dir] epub	    
mobi [options] [source_dir] mobi	    
init [source_dir]   SUMMARY.md    

```

![gitbook](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/2015/gitbook2.png)


### 



### 

1. gitbook`git`
pushgitbook.iobuild. gitbook.iobuild.
  
2. PDF, ePub, mobi

``` bash
gitbook pdf
gitbook epub
gitbook mobi
```

calibreCalibreCalibre   
Gitbookebook-convert   
calibrehttp://www.calibre-ebook.com/    


### 

gitbookkindleElasticsearch


1. github

``` bash
git clone https://github.com/looly/elasticsearch-definitive-guide-cn.git
```

2. 

``` bash
cd elasticsearch-definitive-guide-cn
```

3. mobi 

``` bash
gitbook pdf
gitbook mobi # mobiKindle
```
 
4. mobikindleOKenjoy it

Post._content:
### Web ###
1. MVC Framwork:[SpringMVC](http://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/current/spring-framework-reference/html/mvc.html "SpringMVC")RestfulStrus2
2. CSS Framwork[Twitter Bootstrap](http://getbootstrap.com/ "Bootstrap")
3. Javascript Library[JQuery](http://jquery.com/ "jquery")
4. Validation Framwork:[jQuery Validation](http://jqueryvalidation.org/ "jquery validation"),


### Database ###
1. 
	1. id
	2. 
	3. 
	4. MySQLLinux


2. 
	1. MySqlPostgresql
	2. Oracle


3. NoSql
	1. [MongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/ "mongodb")NosqlBSONSQLschema-less
	2. [Redis](http://redis.io/ "redis")TTLRedisk/vlistsethash
	3. [SSDB](http://ssdb.io/ "ssdb") NoSQL Redis
	4. [HBase](http://hbase.apache.org/ "hbase")GoogleBigtable
4. Cache    
	1. JVMEhcache    
	2. [Guava](http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/ "guava")CacheTTL    


5. ORM     
	1. [MyBatis](http://mybatis.github.io/mybatis-3/zh/index.html "mybatis"),SQLORM
	2. [Hibernate](http://hibernate.org/ "hibernate")ORMJPAHibernateJPAHibernate


### Search Engine ###
1. [Elasticsearch](http://www.elasticsearch.org/ "elasticsearch"),LuceneRESTful;
2. [Solr](http://lucene.apache.org/solr/ "solr"),Lucene


### Services ###
1. Security Framework     
	1. [Apache Shiro](http://shiro.apache.org/ "shiro")Spring Security
	2. Spring Security 


2. Schedule    
	1. [Quartz](http://quartz-scheduler.org/ "quartz-scheduler")
	2. Spring Schedule spring


### Utilizes ###
1. General      
	1. [Apache Commons Lang](http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/ "commons-lang"),Jar
	2. [Guava](http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/ "guava")GoogleJava8Class
	3. [Apache Commons IO](http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/ "commons-io") 
	4. [Commons FileUpload](http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-fileupload/ "commons-fileupload")
2. XML
	1. JDK JAXB ,JDK
	2. [Xstream](http://xstream.codehaus.org/ "xstream") ,Javaxml,,json
3. JSON
	1. [GSon](http://code.google.com/p/google-gson/ "google-gson"),Google
	2. [Jackson](http://jackson.codehaus.org/ "jackson")Spring
	3. [Fastjson](https://github.com/alibaba/fastjson "fastjson")Json
4. Logging
	1. Slf4j,Apache Common Logging,Log
	2. LogbackLog4jLogbackLogstash
5. HttpClient
	1. JDK URLJDKURL
	2. Apache HttpClientApache HttpClientJDK
6. Serializer
	1. JDK Serializer
	2. Jackson Serializer
	3. [Thrift](http://thrift.apache.org/ "thrift")Facebook
	4. [Avro](http://avro.apache.org/ "avro")HadoopDoug Cutting


### Test ###
1. Unit Test:JunitJavaAssertJ Assert
2. Performance/Stability Test[Jmeter]

Post.title: HadoopHadoop2.6.0
Post._content:
### 

#### Ubuntu 14.04 LTS  apt

1. 

``` bash 
sudo apt-get update
```

2. update 


#### IP
IP	

1. interfaces	

``` bash
sudo vi /etc/network/interfaces
```

2. :

``` bash
		#192.168.1.100IP
		auto eth0
		iface eth0 inet static
		address 192.168.1.100 	#IP		
		gateway 192.168.1.1 	#	
		netmask 255.255.255.0
		network 192.168.1.0	
		broadcast 192.168.1.255
	
		#192.168.1.101IP
		auto eth0
		iface eth0 inet static
		address 192.168.1.101 	#IP		
		gateway 192.168.1.1 	#	
		netmask 255.255.255.0
		network 192.168.1.0	
		broadcast 192.168.1.255
```

#### HostName
1. hostname

``` bash
sudo vi /etc/hostname
```

2. `ubuntu`		
3. ubuntu`hostname`


#### IPHostName
1. 

``` bash
sudo vi /etc/hosts
```

2. 


``` bash
		#192.168.1.101IP
		192.168.1.100 hadoop-yarn.jasonsoso.com hadoop-yarn master

		#192.168.1.101IP
		192.168.1.101 slave1.jasonsoso.com slave1
``` 

3. `hadoop-yarn.jasonsoso.com`IP`192.168.1.100`


#### hadoop
 Ubuntu  hadoop  hadoop  123456 ()	

1. 

``` bash
sudo useradd -m hadoop -s /bin/bash
``` 

2. 

``` bash
sudo passwd hadoop
```

3.  hadoop 		

``` bash
sudo adduser hadoop sudo
```



#### Sun JDK 7
 [ubuntujava](http://www.cnblogs.com/fnng/archive/2013/01/30/2883815.html "ubuntujava")  [HOW TO INSTALL ORACLE JAVA 7 IN DEBIAN VIA REPOSITORY](http://www.webupd8.org/2012/06/how-to-install-oracle-java-7-in-debian.html "HOW TO INSTALL ORACLE JAVA 7 IN DEBIAN VIA REPOSITORY")

#### SSH serverSSH

1. 		

``` bash
sudo apt-get install openssh-server
```

2. 		

``` bash
ssh localhost
```

3. SSH	

``` bash
		sudo ssh-keygen -t rsa		# 	
		sudo ssh-copy-id ubuntu@localhost	# 		
		sudo ssh localhost	#	
```

4. SSH


### hadoop2.6.0
1. hadoop2.6.0	
	hadoophttp://hadoop.apache.org/releases.html
2. tar	

``` bash
	sudo tar -zxvf ./hadoop-2.6.0.tar.gz -C /opt/hadoop  # /opt/hadoop
```

	hadoop`/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0`
3. 

``` bash
sudo chown -R hadoop:hadoop ./hadoop-2.6.0
```

### 
1. 	
`#set Hadoop`hadoop`#set java environment`java`#set findbugs``#set ant``#PROTOBUF``#set maven environment`hadoophadoopjavahadoop
		 		
`sudo vi /etc/profile`profile			


``` bash
		#set java environment
		JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60
		export JRE_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60/jre
		export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JRE_HOME/lib:$CLASSPATH
		export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$JRE_HOME/bin:$PATH


		#set findbugs
		export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib/
		export FINDBUGS_HOME=/usr/local/findbugs-3.0.0
		export PATH=$PATH:$FINDBUGS_HOME/bin

		#set ant
		ANT_HOME=/usr/local/apache-ant-1.9.4
		export PATH=$PATH:$ANT_HOME/bin

		#PROTOBUF
		export PROTOC_HOME=/usr/local/protobuf-2.5.0
		export PATH=$PATH:$PROTOC_HOME/bin
		export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$PROTOC_HOME/lib`
	
		#set maven environment
		M2_HOME=/usr/maven/apache-maven-3.0.5
		export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xms256m -Xmx512m"
		export PATH=$M2_HOME/bin:$PATH

		#set Hadoop
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
		export HADOOP_INSTALL=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_HDFS_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_YARN_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_COMMON_LIB_NATIVE_DIR=$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native
		export PATH=$PATH:$HADOOP_HOME/sbin:$HADOOP_HOME/bin
```


2. hadoop-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

3. yarn-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

4. mapred-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

5. core-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>
			<name>fs.default.name</name>
			<value>hdfs://hadoop-yarn.dragon.org:8020</value>
		</property>

		<property>
				<name>hadoop.tmp.dir</name>
				<value>/opt/modules/hadoop-2.2.0/data/tmp</value>
		</property>
```

6. hdfs-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>		
				<name>dfs.replication</name>
				<value>1</value>
		</property>
		<property>
                <name>dfs.permissions</name>
                <value>false</value>
        </property>
```

7. yarn-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>
			<name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services</name>
			<value>mapreduce_shuffle</value>
		</property>
```

8. mapred-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>	 	        		
			<name>mapreduce.framework.name</name>
			<value>yarn</value>
		</property>
```

### 
1. HDFS(NameNodeDataNodeSecondaryNameNode)
	
	- NameNode 
	
``` bash
		bin/hdfs namenode -format
```

	- NameNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start namenode
```

	- DataNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start datanode
```

	- SecondaryNameNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start secondarynamenode
```

2. YARN(ResourceManagerNodeManager)
	- ResourceManger	

``` bash
		sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start resourcemanager
```

	- NodeManager
``` bash
		sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start nodemanager
```

3. 	

``` bash
		sbin/mr-jobhistory-daemon.sh start historyserver
```	

4. 

``` bash
		sbin/start-dfs.sh
		sbin/start-yarn.sh
		sbin/start-all.sh
```


### 

`jps`

![](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/2015/start-all.png)



HDFDNameNode url `http://hadoop-yarn.jasonsoso.com:50070/`

![](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/2015/50070.png)

HDFDSecondary NameNode  url `http://hadoop-yarn.jasonsoso.com:50090/`

![](http://cdn.jasonsoso.com/2015/50090.png)



### Hadoop :

1.  Master 
2.  Master hadoopSSH serverJava
3.  Master Hadoop
4. hadoopSSH serverJava
5.  Master Hadoop
6.  Hadoop

7.  :
	
	- hosts
	- SSH
	-

``` bash
		broadcast 192.168.1.255
```

### hadoop2.6.0
1. hadoop2.6.0	
	hadoophttp://hadoop.apache.org/releases.html
2. tar	

``` bash
	sudo tar -zxvf ./hadoop-2.6.0.tar.gz -C /opt/hadoop  # /opt/hadoop
```

	hadoop`/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0`
3. 

``` bash
sudo chown -R hadoop:hadoop ./hadoop-2.6.0
```

### 
1. 	
`#set Hadoop`hadoop`#set java environment`java`#set findbugs``#set ant``#PROTOBUF``#set maven environment`hadoophadoopjavahadoop
		 		
`sudo vi /etc/profile`profile			


``` bash
		#set java environment
		JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60
		export JRE_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60/jre
		export CLASSPATH=.:$JAVA_HOME/lib:$JRE_HOME/lib:$CLASSPATH
		export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$JRE_HOME/bin:$PATH


		#set findbugs
		export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib/
		export FINDBUGS_HOME=/usr/local/findbugs-3.0.0
		export PATH=$PATH:$FINDBUGS_HOME/bin

		#set ant
		ANT_HOME=/usr/local/apache-ant-1.9.4
		export PATH=$PATH:$ANT_HOME/bin

		#PROTOBUF
		export PROTOC_HOME=/usr/local/protobuf-2.5.0
		export PATH=$PATH:$PROTOC_HOME/bin
		export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$PROTOC_HOME/lib`
	
		#set maven environment
		M2_HOME=/usr/maven/apache-maven-3.0.5
		export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xms256m -Xmx512m"
		export PATH=$M2_HOME/bin:$PATH

		#set Hadoop
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
		export HADOOP_INSTALL=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_MAPRED_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_COMMON_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_HDFS_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_YARN_HOME=$HADOOP_HOME
		export HADOOP_COMMON_LIB_NATIVE_DIR=$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native
		export PATH=$PATH:$HADOOP_HOME/sbin:$HADOOP_HOME/bin
```


2. hadoop-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

3. yarn-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

4. mapred-env.sh

``` bash
		export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.7.0_60		
		export HADOOP_HOME=/opt/hadoop/hadoop-2.6.0
```

5. core-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>
			<name>fs.default.name</name>
			<value>hdfs://hadoop-yarn.dragon.org:8020</value>
		</property>

		<property>
				<name>hadoop.tmp.dir</name>
				<value>/opt/modules/hadoop-2.2.0/data/tmp</value>
		</property>
```

6. hdfs-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>		
				<name>dfs.replication</name>
				<value>1</value>
		</property>
		<property>
                <name>dfs.permissions</name>
                <value>false</value>
        </property>
```

7. yarn-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>
			<name>yarn.nodemanager.aux-services</name>
			<value>mapreduce_shuffle</value>
		</property>
```

8. mapred-site.xml

``` bash
		<property>	 	        		
			<name>mapreduce.framework.name</name>
			<value>yarn</value>
		</property>
```

### 
1. HDFS(NameNodeDataNodeSecondaryNameNode)
	
	- NameNode 
	
``` bash
		bin/hdfs namenode -format
```

	- NameNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start namenode
```

	- DataNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start datanode
```

	- SecondaryNameNode

``` bash
		sbin/hadoop-daemon.sh start secondarynamenode
```

2. YARN(ResourceManagerNodeManager)
	- ResourceManger	

``` bash
		sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start resourcemanager
```

	- NodeManager
``` bash
		sbin/yarn-daemon.sh start nodemanager
```

3. 	

``` bash
		sbin/mr-jobhistory-daemon.sh start historyserver
```	

4. 

``` bash
		sbin/start-dfs.sh
		sbin/start-yarn.sh
		sbin/start-all.sh
```

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

title: Hello World
date: 2022/3/18 14:46:25

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)
